1bdb9ef6-3bfc-4d63-af72-e53fc2b1afa7.description: The course objective is to convey to new CBP Officers the knowledge, skills, and abilities to meet CBP's primary mission to protect America and the American people by preventing terrorists and terrorist weapons from entering the United States, while at the same time facilitating the flow of legitimate trade and travel, in addition to working side by side with Agriculture Specialists to protect America's food supply and agricultural industry.

This training program encompasses the tools, tactics, mindset and methodologies needed to engage the ever-changing threats to our Nation. Prerequisites: In addition to CBP component-specific requirements (e.g., length of service, superior performance), the LESC requires multiple prerequisites.

S. borders including air-to-ground and maritime interception of people and contraband crossing the border and to provide support for CBP's traditional work such as border interceptions unrelated to terrorism.

b9fffd42-168d-46d4-b79a-b2cba5f9eb3b.description: The course objective is to reach a Common European Framework of Reference (CEFR) B1 level of proficiency in the Spanish language which will enable Officers to communicate and effectively carry out job related duties. At a B1 level of proficiency a learner can: understand points regarding family, work, school, or leisure-related topics. In addition, be able to inquire about travel, purpose, destination and decipher simple text.
b9fffd42-168d-46d4-b79a-b2cba5f9eb3b.name: Customs and Border Protection Basic Spanish Training Program (BSTP) (071015)(v.4)

d33f36d1-8359-49f4-90b5-c3d870755f9f.description: The course objective is to provide Customs and Border Protection firearms instructor candidates with the tools necessary to conduct firearms training safely and effectively. The course focuses on CBP's weapon systems, to include their operation, care, and maintenance. It also introduces new instructors to proper use of force techniques, teaching techniques, tactics, scenario-based training, and identifying and resolving shooter problems and errors.
